intro: Bunchosia deflexa, commonly known as the flexible bunchosia, is a shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, often drooping branches and small, ovate leaves. It produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, round fruits. Bunchosia deflexa is typically found in humid, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in partial shade.
